title: Ticket #5572: Clean up port-randomization code.
description:
Todd Tannenbaum wrote:
Can someone explain why the code doesn't simply call get_random_uint() from the util lib instead of these bizarre platform dependent attempts to generate a random number?

There's probably not a good reason (other than to provide the minimal fix). We need the initial port number to be (a) different in different simultaneously-existing processes and (b) different from bind to bind within the same process. Using a PRNG after seeding it with our PID should meet both requirements. If get_random_uint() doesn't do that, we should understand why (and rewrite the port-choosing code to do that unless our understanding of why says we should do something else).
